snippet: The company blamed southern Europe’s economic woes, which has led to rising unemployment and economic stagnation in Spain and Italy, for the nearly $9.3 billion charge.
abstract: Vodafone writes down value of its network businesses in Spain and Italy by 5.9 billion pounds ($9.4 billion), as it struggles to weather the economic downturn in Southern Europe; charge pushes firm to 1.9 billion pound loss ($3 billion) for the six months through Sept. 30, compared with 6.6 billion pound profit in year-ago period.
lead_paragraph: The company blamed southern Europe’s economic woes, which has led to rising unemployment and economic stagnation in Spain and Italy, for the nearly $9.3 billion charge.

headline.seo: Vodafone Writes Down Units in Spain and Italy
headline.main: Vodafone Writes Down Units in Spain and Italy
headline.print_headline: Vodafone Writes Down Units in Spain and Italy
